title: Improving on Expectation Propagation

author: Ulrich Paquet, Department of Process Engineering, Stellenbosch University

segmentation: I've done some work with Manfred and Weller on doing perturbation corrections for EP and the just of what we're doing is the following.
So basically if we're dealing with a posterior in Bayesian inference, that's quite difficult to use.

Typically choose some extra distribution, cute, approximate, or use a surrogate for this posterior and we have VB, and we've seen EPO EC, but what we've done is we've tried to improve our approximations to higher order corrections.
So there just is the following, so EP works on moment matching between our choice of final approximation and a cavity distribution multiplied by a certain factor in a factorized approximation.
And because of this property of moment matching we can expect these two distributions to be quite close.
So if we take the exact motion likelihood in EP.
In this case, we can express it as.

A product of the original approximating distributions and then an expansion of ratios between these cavity times, factor distributions and the approximating distribution that we choose in the end, and this expansion can be taken as small.
I mean, this ratio should be small and we can expand this to various orders.
So basically what we show in our poster is how to take this expansion to 1st and 2nd order and compare the log marginal likelihood.
And how you can improve the predictive density, etc.
So here's a first order correction to do an approximation, just to give you an idea, thank you.
